com.beowulfe.hap.accessories

Interface Fan

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HomekitAccessory

    public interface Fan
extends HomekitAccessory
    A fan, with power and rotational characteristics.
    Author:
    Andy Lintner

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompletableFuture<Boolean> getFanPower()
      Retrieves the current binary state of the fan's power.
      CompletableFuture<RotationDirection> getRotationDirection()
      Retrieves the current rotation direction of the fan.
      CompletableFuture<Integer> getRotationSpeed()
      Retrieves the current speed of the fan's rotation
      default Collection<Service> getServices()
      The collection of Services this accessory supports.
      CompletableFuture<Void> setFanPower(boolean state)
      Sets the binary state of the fan's power
      CompletableFuture<Void> setRotationDirection(RotationDirection direction)
      Sets the rotation direction of the fan
      CompletableFuture<Void> setRotationSpeed(Integer speed)
      Sets the speed of the fan's rotation
      void subscribeFanPower(HomekitCharacteristicChangeCallback callback)
      Subscribes to changes in the binary state of the fan's power.
      void subscribeRotationDirection(HomekitCharacteristicChangeCallback callback)
      Subscribes to changes in the rotation direction of the fan.
      void subscribeRotationSpeed(HomekitCharacteristicChangeCallback callback)
      Subscribes to changes in the rotation speed of the fan.
      void unsubscribeFanPower()
      Unsubscribes from changes in the binary state of the fan's power.
      void unsubscribeRotationDirection()
      Unsubscribes from changes in the rotation direction of the fan.
      void unsubscribeRotationSpeed()
      Unsubscribes from changes in the fan's rotation speed.

    • Method Detail

      • getFanPower

        CompletableFuture<Boolean> getFanPower()
        Retrieves the current binary state of the fan's power.
        Returns:
        a future that will contain the binary state

      • getRotationDirection

        CompletableFuture<RotationDirection> getRotationDirection()
        Retrieves the current rotation direction of the fan.
        Returns:
        a future that will contain the direction

      • getRotationSpeed

        CompletableFuture<Integer> getRotationSpeed()
        Retrieves the current speed of the fan's rotation
        Returns:
        a future that will contain the speed, expressed as an integer between 0 and 100.

      • setFanPower

        CompletableFuture<Void> setFanPower(boolean state)
                             throws Exception
        Sets the binary state of the fan's power
        Parameters:
        state - the binary state to set
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the change is made
        Throws:
        Exception - when the change cannot be made

      • setRotationDirection

        CompletableFuture<Void> setRotationDirection(RotationDirection direction)
                                      throws Exception
        Sets the rotation direction of the fan
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction to set
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the change is made
        Throws:
        Exception - when the change cannot be made

      • setRotationSpeed

        CompletableFuture<Void> setRotationSpeed(Integer speed)
                                  throws Exception
        Sets the speed of the fan's rotation
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed to set, expressed as an integer between 0 and 100.
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the change is made
        Throws:
        Exception - when the change cannot be made

      • getServices

        default Collection<Service> getServices()
        Description copied from interface: HomekitAccessory
        The collection of Services this accessory supports. Services are the primary way to interact with the accessory via Homekit. Besides the Services offered here, the accessory will automatically include the required information service. This method will only be useful if you're implementing your own accessory type. For the standard accessories, use the default implementation provided by the interfaces in com.beowulfe.hap.accessories.
        Specified by:
        getServices in interface HomekitAccessory
        Returns:
        the collection of services.

      • subscribeFanPower

        void subscribeFanPower(HomekitCharacteristicChangeCallback callback)
        Subscribes to changes in the binary state of the fan's power.
        Parameters:
        callback - the function to call when the state changes.

      • subscribeRotationDirection

        void subscribeRotationDirection(HomekitCharacteristicChangeCallback callback)
        Subscribes to changes in the rotation direction of the fan.
        Parameters:
        callback - the function to call when the direction changes.

      • subscribeRotationSpeed

        void subscribeRotationSpeed(HomekitCharacteristicChangeCallback callback)
        Subscribes to changes in the rotation speed of the fan.
        Parameters:
        callback - the function to call when the speed changes.

      • unsubscribeFanPower

        void unsubscribeFanPower()
        Unsubscribes from changes in the binary state of the fan's power.

      • unsubscribeRotationDirection

        Unsubscribes from changes in the rotation direction of the fan.
